revised_title: Debunking Engineering Myths and Celebrating Technical History
tldr: The author discusses the growth of myths surrounding the lives and works of prominent engineers like George Stephenson and Samuel Smiles. The article highlights the importance of studying technical history and biography to debunk these myths and better understand the contributions of engineers and scientists in the Industrial Revolution. It also mentions the publication of a new edition of Charles Babbage's "Passages from the Life of a Philosopher," which sheds light on the history of computing and 19th-century science.
